tit.e: Ijimu no kuni no miyatsuko (regional governor in ancient Japan)
tit.cmt: (government post) government postには違いないと思いますが、これだと中央官僚のようにも聞こえるので、regional governor in ancient Japan（古代日本の地域の統括者）としました。
tit.e: Ijimu no kuni no miyatsuko (regional governor in ancient Japan)

sen.j: 伊甚国造（いじむのくにのみやつこ・いじみのくにのみやつこ・いじむこくぞう・いじみこくぞう)は上総国東部を支配した国造。
sen.e: Ijimunokuninomiyatsuko 伊甚国造 (also known as Ijiminokuninomiyatsuko, Ijimukokuzo, and Ijimikokuzo) ruled the east part of Kazusa Province.
Chichibu no kuni no miyatsuko (知々夫国造) was a kuni no miyatsuko, who ruled the west part of Musashi Province.
Chichibu no kuni no miyatsuko (知々夫国造) was a kuni no miyatsuko, who ruled the west part of Musashi Province.
It was also written as 伊自牟国造.
It was also written as 伊自牟国造.
It was also written as 伊自牟国造.
Takehiratorinomikoto.
Takehiratori no mikoto.
Takehiratori no mikoto.

sen.j: 成務天皇朝に阿波国造の祖伊許保止命の孫の伊己侶止が伊甚国造に任じられたという。
sen.e: Ikoroto, a grandson of Ikohotonomikoto, the founder of Awanokuninomiyatsuko, was appointed Ijimunokuninomiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu.
Ikoroto, a grandson of Ikohoto no mikoto, the founder of Awa no kuni no miyatsuko, was appointed as Ijimunokuni no miyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu.
Ikoroto, a grandson of Ikohoto no mikoto, the founder of Awa no kuni no miyatsuko, was appointed as Ijimunokuni no miyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu.
It was supposedly the Kasukabe clan.
It was supposedly the Kasukabe clan.
It was supposedly the Kasukabe clan.

sen.j: 出雲国造・遠淡海国造・上菟上国造・下菟上国造・无邪志国造・阿波国造などと同系。
sen.e: The clan was descended from the same line as Izumonokuninomiyatsuko, Tootsuominokuninomiyatsuko, Kamituunakamikuninomiyatsuko, Shimotsuunakamikuninomiyatsuko, Musashinokuninomiyatsuko, and Awanokuninomiyatsuko.

The clan was descended from the same line as Izumo no kuni no miyatsuko, Tootsuomino kuni no miyatsuko, Kamituunakami kuni no miyatsuko, Shimotsuunakami kuni no miyatsuko, Musashi no kuni no miyatsuko, and Awa no kuni no miyatsuko.

The clan was descended from the same line as Izumo no kuni no miyatsuko, Tootsuomino kuni no miyatsuko, Kamituunakami kuni no miyatsuko, Shimotsuunakami kuni no miyatsuko, Musashi no kuni no miyatsuko, and Awa no kuni no miyatsuko.

sen.j: 上総国埴生郡(千葉県長生郡・茂原市の一部)。
sen.e: Hanyu Gun, Kazusano Kori (part of Mobara City, Chosei Gun, Chiba Prefecture.)
Hanyu Gun, Kazusano Kori (part of Mobara City, Chosei Gun, Chiba Prefecture.)
Hanyu Gun, Kazusano Kori (part of Mobara City, Chosei Gun, Chiba Prefecture.)

sen.j: 後に同国夷隅郡(いすみ市・勝浦市)も支配した。
sen.e: Later, Ijimunokuninomiyatsuko ruled Izumi Gori in the same Province (Izumi City, Katsuura City.)
Later, Ijimuno kuni no miyatsuko ruled Izumi Gori in the same Province (Izumi City, Katsuura City).
Later, Ijimuno kuni no miyatsuko ruled Izumi Gori in the same Province (Izumi City, Katsuura City).

sen.j: 玉前神社(千葉県一宮町)か。
sen.e: It is supposed to be Tamasakijinja shrine (Ichinomiyamachi, Chiba Prefecture)
Probably, Tamasaki-jinja Shrine (current Ichinomiya Machi, Chiba Prefecture)
Probably, Tamasaki-jinja Shrine (current Ichinomiya Machi, Chiba Prefecture)
The enshrined deity is Tamasakijin.
The enshrined deity is Tamasakijin.
The enshrined deity is Tamasakijin.

sen.j: 伊甚稚子 ...... 古墳時代の豪族。
sen.e: IJIMI no Wakugo: A regional powerful clan during the Kofun period.
IJIMI no Wakugo: A regional powerful clan during the Kofun period.
IJIMI no Wakugo: A regional powerful clan during the Kofun period.

sen.j: 安閑天皇朝の伊甚国造。
sen.e: Ijimunokuninomiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Ankan.
Ijimu no kuni no miyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Ankan.
Ijimu no kuni no miyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Ankan.

sen.j: 過失のため伊甚屯倉を春日山田皇女皇后に献上したという。
sen.e: In apology for his mistake, he presented Ijimunomiyake to Kasuganoyamadanohimemiko.
In apology for his mistake, he presented the Ijimuno miyake to Kasuganoyamada no himemiko.
In apology for his mistake, he presented the Ijimuno miyake to Kasuganoyamada no himemiko.
